quotes.author: Gregor Mendel
quotes.quote: My scientific studies have afforded me great gratification.

quotes.author: Thomas Hunt Morgan
quotes.quote: Genes are arranged like beads on a string.

quotes.author: Barbara McClintock
quotes.quote: If you know you are on the right track, if you have this inner knowledge, then nobody can turn you off.
quotes.meaning: Internal conviction enables persistence despite opposition.

quotes.author: James Watson
quotes.quote: We've discovered the secret of life.

quotes.author: Francis Crick
quotes.quote: You're nothing but a pack of neurons.
quotes.meaning: Human experience reduces to neural activity.

quotes.author: Rosalind Franklin
quotes.quote: Science and everyday life cannot and should not be separated.
quotes.meaning: Research connects intimately with ordinary experience.

quotes.author: Lynn Margulis
quotes.quote: Life did not take over the globe by combat, but by networking.
quotes.meaning: Symbiosis, not competition, drives evolutionary success.

quotes.author: Ernst Mayr
quotes.quote: Theory helps us bear our ignorance of facts.
quotes.meaning: Conceptual frameworks compensate for incomplete data.

quotes.author: Theodosius Dobzhansky
quotes.quote: Nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution.
quotes.meaning: Evolutionary theory unifies all biological understanding.

quotes.author: Stephen Jay Gould
quotes.quote: I am, somehow, less interested in the weight and convolutions of Einstein's brain than in the near certainty that people of equal talent have lived and died in cotton fields and sweatshops.
quotes.meaning: Opportunity, not ability, often determines achievement.

quotes.author: Richard Lewontin
quotes.quote: It is time for students of the evolutionary process to explore the consequences of the abandonment of progress.

quotes.author: John Maynard Smith
quotes.quote: Genetics is about how information is stored and transmitted between generations.

quotes.author: E.O. Wilson
quotes.quote: The real problem of humanity is the following: we have paleolithic emotions, medieval institutions, and god-like technology.

quotes.author: Konrad Lorenz
quotes.quote: Barking dogs occasionally bite, but laughing men hardly ever shoot.
quotes.meaning: Display behavior often substitutes for actual aggression.

quotes.author: Nikolaas Tinbergen
quotes.quote: To the man who studies animal behavior, the world is a treasure house.

quotes.author: Karl von Frisch
quotes.quote: The bee's life is like a magic well: the more you draw from it, the more it fills with water.

quotes.author: Dian Fossey
quotes.quote: The more you learn about the dignity of the gorilla, the more you want to avoid people.
quotes.meaning: Animal nobility contrasts with human failings.

quotes.author: Frans de Waal
quotes.quote: To endow animals with human emotions has long been a scientific taboo. But if we do not, we risk missing something fundamental.
quotes.meaning: Anthropomorphism may reveal truth despite methodological concerns.

quotes.author: Temple Grandin
quotes.quote: I think using animals for food is an ethical thing to do, but we've got to do it right.

quotes.author: Alexander Fleming
quotes.quote: When I woke up just after dawn on September 28, 1928, I certainly didn't plan to revolutionize all medicine by discovering the world's first antibiotic.
quotes.meaning: Major discoveries occur unexpectedly during routine work.

quotes.author: Louis Pasteur
quotes.quote: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity.

quotes.author: Robert Koch
quotes.quote: If my efforts have led to greater success than usual, this is due to the fact that during my wanderings in the field of medicine, I have strayed onto paths where the gold was still lying by the wayside.

quotes.author: Paul Ehrlich
quotes.quote: Success in research needs four Gs: Glück, Geduld, Geschick und Geld.
quotes.meaning: Discovery requires luck, patience, skill, and money.

quotes.author: Ignaz Semmelweis
quotes.quote: When will we learn?
quotes.meaning: Frustration at medical establishment's resistance to evidence.

quotes.author: Joseph Lister
quotes.quote: It is our proud office to tend the fleshly tabernacle of the immortal spirit.
quotes.meaning: Medicine serves spiritual beings through physical care.

quotes.author: William Osler
quotes.quote: Listen to your patient, he is telling you the diagnosis.

quotes.author: Harvey Cushing
quotes.quote: A physician is obligated to consider more than a diseased organ, more even than the whole man—he must view the man in his world.

quotes.author: Jonas Salk
quotes.quote: The reward for work well done is the opportunity to do more.

quotes.author: Albert Sabin
quotes.quote: A scientist who is also a human being cannot rest while knowledge which might be used to reduce suffering rests on the shelf.

quotes.author: Frederick Banting
quotes.quote: Insulin is not a cure for diabetes; it is a treatment.
quotes.meaning: Management differs from elimination of disease.

quotes.author: Gertrude Elion
quotes.quote: Don't be afraid of hard work. Nothing worthwhile comes easily.

quotes.author: Rosalyn Yalow
quotes.quote: The world cannot afford the loss of the talents of half its people if we are to solve the many problems which beset us.
quotes.meaning: Gender equality essential for addressing global challenges.

quotes.author: Rita Levi-Montalcini
quotes.quote: Above all, don't fear difficult moments. The best comes from them.

quotes.author: Santiago Ramón y Cajal
quotes.quote: As long as our brain is a mystery, the universe will also be a mystery.
quotes.meaning: Understanding consciousness key to cosmic comprehension.

quotes.author: Wilder Penfield
quotes.quote: The brain is the organ of destiny. It holds within its humming mechanism secrets that will determine the future of the human race.
quotes.meaning: Neural function determines collective human trajectory.

quotes.author: Oliver Sacks
quotes.quote: Every act of perception is to some degree an act of creation.

quotes.author: V.S. Ramachandran
quotes.quote: The human brain, it has been said, is the most complexly organized structure in the universe.
quotes.meaning: Neural architecture exceeds all other known systems.

quotes.author: Eric Kandel
quotes.quote: Memory is everything.
quotes.meaning: Recollection forms foundation of identity and knowledge.

quotes.author: Rodolfo Llinás
quotes.quote: That which we call thinking is the evolutionary internalization of movement.

quotes.author: Antonio Damasio
quotes.quote: We are not thinking machines that feel; rather, we are feeling machines that think.

quotes.author: Christof Koch
quotes.quote: Consciousness is the last great mystery facing science.

quotes.author: Michael Gazzaniga
quotes.quote: The interpreter is the last device in the information chain in our brain.

quotes.author: Patricia Churchland
quotes.quote: Epistemology is concerned with how we know what we know.

quotes.author: Stanislas Dehaene
quotes.quote: Consciousness is nothing but the consequence of neuronal architecture.

quotes.author: Giulio Tononi
quotes.quote: Consciousness is integrated information.

quotes.author: David Eagleman
quotes.quote: Your brain is built of cells called neurons and glia - hundreds of billions of them.
quotes.meaning: Mind emerges from vast cellular networks.

quotes.author: Robert Sapolsky
quotes.quote: We are just another primate.
quotes.meaning: Humans share fundamental biology with other species.

quotes.author: Linus Pauling
quotes.quote: The best way to have a good idea is to have lots of ideas.
quotes.meaning: Quantity generates quality in creative work.

quotes.author: Dorothy Hodgkin
quotes.quote: I was captured for life by chemistry and by crystals.

quotes.author: Ahmed Zewail
quotes.quote: Science knows no boundaries.
quotes.meaning: Discovery transcends geographic and cultural limits.

quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.quote: In science, we must be interested in things, not in persons.
quotes.meaning: Focus on phenomena rather than personalities.

quotes.author: Dmitri Mendeleev
quotes.quote: Elements which are similar in their chemical properties have atomic weights which are either of nearly the same value or which increase regularly.

quotes.author: Gilbert N. Lewis
quotes.quote: The scientist is a practical man and his are practical aims.

quotes.author: Irving Langmuir
quotes.quote: Pathological science is the science of things that aren't so.

quotes.author: Linus Torvalds
quotes.quote: Software is like sex: it's better when it's free.
quotes.meaning: Open access improves quality and distribution.

quotes.author: Claude Shannon
quotes.quote: Information is the resolution of uncertainty.
quotes.meaning: Data reduces possible states to actuality.

quotes.author: John von Neumann
quotes.quote: If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is.
quotes.meaning: Math is clearer than messy reality.

quotes.author: Alan Turing
quotes.quote: Sometimes it is the people no one imagines anything of who do the things that no one can imagine.

quotes.author: Kurt Gödel
quotes.quote: The more I think about language, the more it amazes me that people ever understand each other.

quotes.author: David Hilbert
quotes.quote: We must know, we will know.
quotes.meaning: Mathematical problems are solvable with effort.

quotes.author: Emmy Noether
quotes.quote: My methods are really methods of working and thinking; this is why they have crept in everywhere anonymously.
quotes.meaning: Approach matters more than credited discoveries.

quotes.author: Henri Poincaré
quotes.quote: Mathematics is the art of giving the same name to different things.

quotes.author: Srinivasa Ramanujan
quotes.quote: An equation means nothing to me unless it expresses a thought of God.

quotes.author: G.H. Hardy
quotes.quote: A mathematician, like a painter or poet, is a maker of patterns.

quotes.author: Paul Erdős
quotes.quote: A mathematician is a device for turning coffee into theorems.

quotes.author: Leonhard Euler
quotes.quote: Read Euler, read Euler, he is the master of us all.

quotes.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss
quotes.quote: Mathematics is the queen of sciences.

quotes.author: Pierre de Fermat
quotes.quote: I have discovered a truly marvelous proof of this, which this margin is too narrow to contain.

quotes.author: Bernhard Riemann
quotes.quote: If only I had the theorems! Then I should find the proofs easily enough.

quotes.author: Georg Cantor
quotes.quote: The essence of mathematics lies in its freedom.
quotes.meaning: Abstract reasoning operates without physical constraints.

quotes.author: Felix Klein
quotes.quote: Everyone knows what a curve is, until he has studied enough mathematics to become confused.

quotes.author: Sophus Lie
quotes.quote: The theory of groups is a branch of mathematics in which one does something to something and then compares the result with the result obtained from doing the same thing to something else.

quotes.author: Henri Lebesgue
quotes.quote: Reduced to general theories, mathematics would be a beautiful form without content.

quotes.author: John Horton Conway
quotes.quote: You can't tell me what to do.

quotes.author: Andrew Wiles
quotes.quote: Perhaps I can best describe my experience of doing mathematics in terms of a journey through a dark unexplored mansion.

quotes.author: Terence Tao
quotes.quote: There's a common belief that mathematics is about finding the shortest, slickest proof. Actually, good mathematics is about finding the proof that gives the most insight.

quotes.author: Maryam Mirzakhani
quotes.quote: The beauty of mathematics only shows itself to more patient followers.

quotes.author: Timothy Gowers
quotes.quote: Mathematicians are like managers - they want other people to do the work.

quotes.author: Alexandre Grothendieck
quotes.quote: The introduction of the cipher 0 or the group concept was general nonsense too, and mathematics was more or less stagnating for thousands of years because nobody was around to take such childish steps.

quotes.author: Benoit Mandelbrot
quotes.quote: Clouds are not spheres, mountains are not cones, coastlines are not circles.
quotes.meaning: Nature requires fractal, not Euclidean, geometry.

quotes.author: René Thom
quotes.quote: At a time when so many scholars in the world are calculating, is it not desirable that some, who can, dream?

quotes.author: Hermann Weyl
quotes.quote: My work always tried to unite the true with the beautiful, but when I had to choose one or the other, I usually chose the beautiful.
quotes.meaning: Aesthetic appeal can guide theoretical choices.

quotes.author: André Weil
quotes.quote: God exists since mathematics is consistent, and the Devil exists since we cannot prove it.

quotes.author: Norbert Wiener
quotes.quote: The best material model of a cat is another cat.
quotes.meaning: Complexity resists reduction to simpler systems.

quotes.author: Archimedes
quotes.quote: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
quotes.meaning: Mechanical advantage enables seemingly impossible tasks.

quotes.author: Euclid
quotes.quote: There is no royal road to geometry.
quotes.meaning: Understanding requires effort regardless of status.

quotes.author: Apollonius of Perga
quotes.quote: The study of conic sections enriches the mind.

quotes.author: Diophantus
quotes.quote: To find a square number which when increased or diminished by a given number becomes a square.

quotes.author: Hypatia
quotes.quote: Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.

quotes.author: Omar Khayyam
quotes.quote: The moving finger writes, and having written moves on.
quotes.meaning: Time's passage is irreversible and definitive.

quotes.author: Al-Khwarizmi
quotes.quote: When I consider what people generally want in calculating, I found that it always is a number.

quotes.author: Avicenna
quotes.quote: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.
